result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Garcia

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Ricardo Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner and Krystine Watson in court for Ricardo Garcia.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  No new eval filed.  Atty Watson no longer has concerns about DE's competency.  DE agrees with the findings of the previous report.  State stips to the findings of the previous report.  Court accepts stip of parties and finds that the DE is comp to proceed.   DE stips to probable cause and waives PH. Waiver form completed.  DE advised of his rights. DE bound over.  Information filed.  NG plea entered.  20CF590 scheduled 10/5 9am - that hearing removed and all 3 cases scheduled together.  DE will appear in person for next hearing. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Drew Lehman in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M. Knapp and Atty Kristyne Watson in court with Defendant Ricardo Garcia.  Clerk: PU  
  Minutes:  Parties have no conflict with case being heard before Judge Gabriele today.  Atty Knapp and Atty Watson request a new date to complete an independent evaluation; no objection by the State.  Competency hearing adjourned to September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
and Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
CH reset from 7/15 to 7/26 on request of Wis. Forensic Unit
Competency hearing on July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Submitted by WFU
re:  Extension request
Comp Order CR 205 and crim complaint emailed to DHS, WCS notified and copy to KCJ
Proposed Order for Comp Exam Form CR 205

Defendant Ricardo Garcia appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp and Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.      Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Knapp raises issue of competency; Court orders comp exam.  Bond continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.
